channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: A trial of suspects accused of robbing Kim Kardashian at gunpoint begins in Paris
item.description: In 2016, thieves robbed Kim Kardashian at gunpoint in Paris and made away with about $10 million in jewelry. The suspects, whom the French press have dubbed "grandpa robbers," are now on trial.

item.title: Trump's Harvard funding cuts don't put 'America first,' says Massachusetts governor
item.description: Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey argues President Trump's funding cuts to Harvard University and other universities are detrimental to the economy.

item.title: Marc Short, former chief of staff to VP Pence, discusses Trump's 100 days in office
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Marc Short, former chief of staff to Vice President Mike Pence, about the differences in President Trump's second-term agenda from his first term.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Poll finds most disapprove of how Trump is handling economy, NPR analysis shows Trump has taken action against more than 100 people and institutions, Columbia University student speaks from detention.

item.title: Airline that struck deal to operate deportation flights faces growing backlash
item.description: Facing financial headwinds, budget carrier Avelo Airlines struck a deal to operate deportation flights for ICE. Now it's facing a backlash from customers and politicians.

item.title: Ohio tattoo shop helps trauma and abuse survivors transform scars into art
item.description: A tattoo shop in Ohio helps trauma and abuse survivors reclaim their bodies by transforming scars into beautiful tattooed art

item.title: Cause of blackout in Spain and Portugal still unclear as power almost fully returned
item.description: An unprecedented power outage hit Spain, as well parts of Portugal and southern France on Monday. Power has almost fully returned Tuesday, but the cause of the outage remains unclear.

item.title: Texas A&M senior research engineer describes the kinds of risks facing power grids
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with senior research engineer Jonathan Snodgrass at Texas A&M University about the safety of power grids after three countries in Europe experienced blackouts.

item.title: Mohsen Mahdawi — the Columbia student arrested at his citizenship appointment — speaks
item.description: Speaking to NPR in his first media interview since his detention, lawful permanent U.S. resident Mohsen Mahdawi finds peace in meditation and hopes "America will fulfill its promise."

item.title: How the conclave to elect the new pope works
item.description: Now that the start date of the papal conclave has been set for May 7, NPR walks through who'll be there and how they'll be electing the next leader of the Roman Catholic Church.
